ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient's features (sensorineural hearing impairment and delayed speech and language development) closely match the reference cases, all of which were diagnosed with this condition.
This condition also presents with sensorineural hearing impairment and delayed speech development, though the reference cases suggest autosomal recessive 125 is more likely.
Usher syndrome can present with sensorineural hearing loss and delayed speech, though it typically includes retinitis pigmentosa, which is not mentioned here.
Pendred syndrome includes sensorineural hearing loss and may involve delayed speech, but it often includes thyroid abnormalities, which are not noted here.
This syndrome can include sensorineural hearing loss and delayed speech, but it typically involves pigmentary abnormalities of the hair, skin, and eyes, which are not mentioned.
